snippet: The size of the deal for the writer of the best-selling “Sigma” series is especially unusual because there weren’t multiple bidders, and he wasn’t going to another publishing house.
abstract: William Morrow's agreement to pay thriller writer James Rollins close to $15 million for next four books in his best-selling Sigma series signals imprint's confidence that Rollins's readership will continue to grow; deal is unusual not only for its size, but also because there were not multiple bidders, and Rollins was not going to another publishing house.
lead_paragraph: The size of the deal for the writer of the best-selling “Sigma” series is especially unusual because there weren’t multiple bidders, and he wasn’t going to another publishing house.

headline.main: James Rollins Receives a $15 Million Multibook Deal
headline.print_headline: $15 Million Book Deal for Author of Thrillers
